paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for BRCA2, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The BRCA2 c.7913_7917del5 mutation was found in an affected female with a severe family history of breast cancer.

functional_data.summary: Truncating mutation leading to loss of function.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: Identified in a family with a strong history of breast cancer.
key_quotes: The BRCA2 c.7913_7917del5 mutation was found in an affected female with a severe family history of breast cancer.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The BRCA2 c.9403delC mutation was found in an affected male with a family history of breast cancer.

functional_data.summary: Truncating mutation leading to loss of function.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: Identified in a family with a strong history of breast cancer.
key_quotes: The BRCA2 c.9403delC mutation was found in an affected male with a family history of breast cancer.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The G to A transition in the last nucleotide of BRCA2 exon 5 (c.475G>A) results in a transcript lacking in frame exon 5.
This mutation was identified in two unrelated families that were too small to evaluate segregation.

functional_data.summary: Results in a transcript lacking in frame exon 5.

variants.segregation_data: Not clearly established due to small family size.
key_quotes: The G to A transition in the last nucleotide of BRCA2 exon 5 (c.475G>A) results in a transcript lacking in frame exon 5.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The BRCA2 c.7007G>A mutation was found in an affected female with a severe family history of breast cancer.
The BRCA2 c.7007G>A mutation was found in an affected male with a maternal aunt and cousin diagnosed with breast cancer.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: Identified in a family with a strong history of breast cancer.
key_quotes: The BRCA2 c.7007G>A mutation was found in an affected female with a severe family history of breast cancer.

tables_processed.table_caption: Spectrum of frame-shift and nonsense BRCA2 germline mutations detected in Czech patients.
Splice-site alterations detected in Czech high-risk breast/ovarian cancer patients.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant BRCA2 variants were extracted with detailed penetrance data.
